section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. <*$p$*>The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience.
explanation: The first sentence states the customer is responsible for paying the monthly fee, implying an obligation. The second sentence says the customer pays at their 'discretion and convenience,' which contradicts the idea of a mandatory payment. This creates ambiguity about whether the customer is actually obligated to pay the fee.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The statement that failure to pay fees 'in a timely manner' will result in service interruption creates a contradiction. If payment is truly at the customer's 'discretion and convenience,' there shouldn't be a penalty (service interruption) for late or non-payment. This imposes a consequence that conflicts with the discretionary payment provision.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen (15) days' written notice.
explanation: These statements contain contradictory elements. The first sentence implies a renewal term of one month, while the second permits termination at any time with fifteen days' notice. If termination is possible 'at any time,' this contradicts the automatic renewal clause because the contract could be terminated before the start of the new month.
